page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In 1923 there were about 6 cars, belonging to business people. Most farmers used ponies and traps. Calves went to market in a float but there were 2 cattle vans in the area. Cattle would often be walked to the market in Wrexham.There were 3 buses a week run by Williams and Hodgson from Wrexham to Overton.If families were going anywhere special, they hired a taxi. Some farms date back to the C17th e.g. Eyton Bank 1649, others were built earlier but most later.A chapel on the way to Erbistock lies unused and unsold because the deeds have never been found. During the Second World War, the army had a camp on the Wynnstay Estate and a headquarters in the hall(now Lindisfarne School).
